paragraph.paragraph: Debug clauses provide a way to optional execute sections of code based on what debug clauses have been set from the active project configuration. Eiffel debug clauses are not to be confused or compared with the #ifdef...#else...#end preprocessors found in C/C++ or similar languages. Debug clauses, as there name suggests are for debugging purposes and not to conditional compile code for a given project's ms-help//MS.VSCC.2003/MS.MSDNQTR.2003FEB.1033/vsintro7/html/vxconBuildConfigurations.htmBuild Configuration.

To assist in the development of projects, new EiffelEnvision projects will be assigned two debug clauses. The first one of these two clauses will be held and set internally by EiffelEnvision and, as a result, cannot be modified. The debug clause reflects the ../eiffelenvision_projects/configuring/project_configuration/general.xmloutput_typeOutput Type property for a given project. For instance selecting the Console Application project output type will add the debug clauses "Console Application".

On a project level a debug clause for the ../eiffelenvision_projects/configuring/project_configuration/general.xmloutput_typeOutput Type property will be set. This means that if the project is a Console Application, a "console application" debug clause will be set. Debug clauses are case-insensitive, just as is Eiffel so there is no need to match the case used by the ../eiffelenvision_projects/configuring/project_configuration/general.xmloutput_typeOutput Type property.

The second of the preset debug clauses pertains to the active ../eiffelenvision_projects/configuring/project_configuration/index.xmlProject Configuration. When adding a new project a debug clause will be added to the list of mutable ../eiffelenvision_projects/configuring/project_configuration/debugging.xmldebug_clausesDebugging Properties in the ../eiffelenvision_projects/configuring/project_configuration/debugging.xmlDebugging Properties. The name given to the debug clause is the name of the project configuration. For the default Debug configuration there will be a "debug" debug clauses and for the Release configuration there will be a "release" debug clause. For new configuration added through the ms-help//MS.VSCC.2003/MS.MSDNQTR.2003FEB.1033/vsintro7/html/vxurfConfigurationManagerDialogBoxS.htmConfiguration Manager dialog box, a new debug clause will not be added with the same name given to the new ms-help//MS.VSCC.2003/MS.MSDNQTR.2003FEB.1033/vsintro7/html/vxconBuildConfigurations.htmConfiguration. Configuration debug clauses can be removed as they are not set internally by EiffelEnvision.
